channel.title: Help with easyRSC
channel.description: So sorry I am kind of new at this, I just want to mess around with RSC with just me, kind of like singleplayer. I can do this using easy RSC I believe, but I have no clue how to go about setting up the server? Could someone guide me through it step by step? Thanks so much!

item.title: Help with easyRSC
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Did you figure this out yet?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easyRSC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Maybe you should realize there is a wall for new people when entering the community, the exact reason Easyrsc was created. Help ye old sport out.

Yes but if you don’t know how to edit files on your OS then you shouldn’t even try to program

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easyRSC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“montesinos7, post:12, topic:520152”][quote author=tigerclan link=topic=638645.msg4305307#msg4305307 date=1369686063]

how would I set my environmental variables “properly”

http://lmgtfy.com/?q=how+to+set+up+java+environment+variables

Right so I have java and set them up, now what, still the same errors.

lol, sorry, i was drunk when i posted that. if it doesnt say “edit”, then click “open with” and select any text editor you want(notepad, etc). dont use wordpad
[/quote]

There is no option to “open with” either.[/quote]

If you somehow don’t have those edit and open with options on your computer you should consider just throwing it out the window

Read full topic

item.title: Help with easyRSC
item.dc:creator: @montesinos7 montesinos7
item.description:
@montesinos7 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:4, topic:520152”][quote author=montesinos7 link=topic=638645.msg4304939#msg4304939 date=1369622346]

  1. double click ‘run server.bat’
  2. wait for the server info window to pop up
  3. press the ‘Start Server’ button
  4. double click ‘run client.bat’
  5. log into the game
  6. …
  7. profit
  8. repeat

I double click run server.bat and it pops up for a fraction of a second then immediately closes
[/quote]

add “pause” to the bottom of ant.bat[/quote]

How would I go about doing that? When I open ant.bat it also immediately closes

You need Java installed and your environmental variables set properly. Google is your best friend.

I have Java installed and how would I set my environmental variables “properly”

Read full topic
